summary: This document is a forwarded email chain from May 2020 containing threatening messages sent from an individual using the alias "Puggie" to an unknown recipient. The messages threaten violence, including murder of the recipient's family, to prevent testimony or cooperation with authorities, and reference a mysterious "boss" connected to the recipient's brother's death.

persons.name: Mark L. Epstein
persons.context: Appears as the sender who forwarded the threatening email chain to Stacey Richman and Kevin Ponder.

persons.name: Stacey Richman
persons.context: Recipient of the forwarded email from Mark L. Epstein; email address suggests she is a lawyer.

persons.name: Kevin Ponder
persons.context: Named as the person to whom Mark L. Epstein is forwarding the threatening email chain.

persons.name: Puggie
persons.context: Pseudonym used by the sender of a series of threatening emails that reference a "boss," the recipient's brother's death, and threats against the recipient's family to prevent court testimony.

connections.description: Mark L. Epstein forwarded a threatening email chain to Stacey Richman's law firm email address.
Mark L. Epstein states the email is being forwarded to Kevin Ponder.
Puggie sends repeated threats of violence and murder to an unnamed recipient to intimidate them regarding court testimony and their brother's death.
Puggie acts on behalf of or under the direction of an unnamed "boss" who is interested in the recipient and allegedly connected to the recipient's brother's death.

events.title: Initial Threatening Emails Sent
events.description: A series of threatening emails are sent from "Puggie" to an unknown recipient, referencing the recipient's brother's death and demanding they not cooperate with the court.

events.title: Threat Escalation and Forwarding
events.description: Puggie sends a more direct threat to suffocate the recipient. Later that day, Mark L. Epstein forwards the entire email chain to Stacey Richman and Kevin Ponder.

events.title: Brother's Death
events.description: Referenced in the threats as a past event where the recipient's brother was killed, allegedly because he "wanted to tell the court everything."

keyFacts: The document contains a forwarded chain of explicit death threats sent in May 2020, intended to intimidate an unknown recipient from cooperating with authorities or testifying in court.
The threats reference a mysterious "boss" who allegedly loved the recipient's brother but was involved in his death because the brother wanted to testify.
The sender, using the alias "Puggie," threatens to kill the recipient's children and suffocate the recipient if they do not respond or if they talk to police.
Mark L. Epstein forwarded this threatening correspondence to attorney Stacey Richman and Kevin Ponder, suggesting legal or protective awareness of the threats.
